biotools.summary: search engine for ranking genes from arbitrary text queries | Submit biomedical terms to receive ranked lists of relevant genes | Submit any search terms to Geneshot to receive prioritized genes that are most relevant to the search terms. Geneshot finds publications that mention both the search terms and genes. It then prioritizes these genes using various methods: 1) list of genes from publications; 2) predicted genes using gene-gene similarity matrices derived from a variety of resources ( ARCHS4 : Enrichr : Tagger : AutoRIF : GeneRIF ) | Examples: Wound healing : Hair loss : Trichostatin A : Glioblastoma : Diabetes

bioschemas.name: Geneshot

It then prioritizes these genes using various methods: 1) list of genes from publications; 2) predicted genes using gene-gene similarity matrices derived from a variety of resources ( ARCHS4 : Enrichr : Tagger : AutoRIF : GeneRIF ) | Examples: Wound healing : Hair loss : Trichostatin A : Glioblastoma : Diabetes
